author: yangkehua
title: Cardano Blockchain Buenos Aires Hub
description: The Cardano Community in Argentina is growing potentially everyday, presential events will stronger the multi-interaction in our Community

f6_assessments.q0: The problem presented by the team was not really presented as an opportunity, they basically seek to continue strengthening the community in Buenos Aires, which is already taking off. I must say that from my experience I agree with what the team proposes since we are seeing more and more proposals coming from this country, this is a clear sign of the permeability of the ecosystem in this society. To improve this proposal I would recommend the team the following: 1) In the solution section it describes "...workshops in Cardano community and attract newcomers." but it does not explain the details of these workshops or outreach methodologies to attract these newcomers, although I can understand that the focus of these events will be networking for the generation of new teams and ideas, the topics that will be discussed in these workshops as well as the speakers will be key to increase or not the level of attendance and retention of these events. 2) Improve alignment with one of the principles of this challenge, which is "Delivering information to people who would not otherwise have the access." Why do I say this? basically because I do not see any outreach initiative as such and in fact in response to the question "Please describe how your proposed solution will address the challenge?" the team responded that through communication in their meetup channels, LATAM TOWNHALL discord and twitter. While organically new interested people could reach these channels and receive the information, this proposal would be more robust if it presented actions on how to address this principle proactively. 3) To evaluate the impact it is important to analyze the proposed metrics versus the impact that the challenge expects, and here I do not see a direct alignment unfortunately, the proposal addresses the number of participants in the events, when the challenge expects that new Cardano Onboarded users can be measured. Yes, it can be argued that there is a high probability that whoever participates in the events will become an ADA holder, but it would be necessary for the team to track this information. Based on the above, I assign a value of 4.
f6_assessments.q1: The core members of this team are the organizers of the Cardano Summit Buenos Aires as well as being the moderators of the Cardano Blockchain Buenos Aires group which has 655 members, this for me counts as sufficient evidence to be in compliance with this requirement, it also describes the roles and the number of people who would be involved in the implementation. The budget is divided in enough items so that the logic behind the amount requested can be understood, the values seem to me to be in line with the Argentinean market and complies with the requirement of not exceeding 5% of the budget of the challenge. Due to the purpose of this proposal the implementation plan is not expected to be complex, and it is not. They present a series of actions that, although simple, meet the minimum expected from my point of view. Regarding the risks, they only describe what they believe to be the only risk, but do not present a countermeasure to address it, perhaps the possibility of hosting events outdoors? or semi-enclosed spaces? online? The problem of the high dropout rate of this type of events is not addressed either, I would have expected some kind of attendee retention strategy from the team. Overall, taking into account the experience of the proponents, the amount requested and the low complexity of the actions, I agree with the allocation of funds from a feasibility point of view.
f6_assessments.q2: Auditability in this type of proposal is really simple, and the team that prepared this proposal approaches it in the right way. They propose to make a record through photos and videos of each event. I would recommend complementing this with alternative measures so that the community can check the level of participation as planned. Regarding the definition of metrics / KPIs presents 3 metrics, the first I took as an example in the impact section that although it is not directly with what the challenge asks is necessary to measure it, the second where they intend to double the members of the Cardano Blockchain Buenos Aires meetup and finally match 30 investors with projects. The metrics seem to me appropriate and simple to measure. I would add, minimally number of proposals in Catalyst as a result of networking in these events and new Cardano wallets per event to improve alignment with the challenge.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposer suggests that the Cardano Community in Argentina is growing potentially everyday, presential events will stronger the multi-interaction in our Community and needs host presential events once a month providing interactions, business opportunities, workshops in Cardano community and attract newcomers. This will help the people to interact with each other even if there are circumstances where they cannot meet each other in person. The proposer has identified a need for a hub in caradano blockchain in Argentina and has also worked towards the implementation which is impressive and it will attract a lot of people to get involved in this and hence increase the popularity and face value of the cardano ecosystem. The proposer has already pointed out the challenges they will be facing and also has alternate solutions to the challenges and the challenges can be scalable.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer has a very innovative idea of introducing a hub for Cardano blockchain in Argentina and has also provided referral links to provide evidence of relevant skills and experience needed to implement the proposal and his team seems to be very well versed in many of the topics required to implement the proposal. The budget is outlined clearly and is broken down into identifiable items which seems to be fair and is reasonable. The proposal also offers a realistic time to complete the project in time. The proposer has already pointed out the challenges they will be facing and also has alternate solutions to the challenges and the challenges can be scalable. By the given experience and the plan for the proposal is more likely to be implemented.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposer has a planned roadmap to achieve the proposal. The proposer has request funds of 11500 USD and also given the breakup cost of all the identifiable items which seems fair and is reasonable to achieve the goal. Proposer has identified a real world problem, understood it and is working towards a solution to solve the problem and the provided information is sufficient to audit the progress. The expertise and the knowledge from the proposer and his team and the implementation of the plan is more likely to succeed.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal suit well with the goal of the challenge.
This team offers 12 monthly on_site meetings in a year to attract Argentinean investors who are going through an economic situation with very high inflation in the country, giving them opportunities to learn about Cardano and also gives a chance for some talented people to find with whom to develop work on new proposals in Catalyst projects. 
In such a stormy country to live in, people need to find a way out and this team will bring them hope: Cardano.
f6_assessments.q1:
It is clear that this team has the ability to conduct and carry out these 12 events and share their experiences with the Summit Cardano 2021. 
They also provide a plan detailing that every 3 months the progress they are going to have, number of participants, number of members that are going to increase and partnerup the researchers that have some projects. 
And the figures of the expenses are detailed well clearly and quite reasonable.
It seems to be a concrete plan and with a good chance that they will be able to conclude it.
f6_assessments.q2: The results can be well reviewed by the photos and videos provided by the team of each event, so the auditability would not have any difficulty.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal effectively matches the challenge. I believe this event can attract a lot of people, because the arrangement of the event not only allows more newcomers to participate in CARDANO, but also allows more two-way interaction by meeting people from different fields on the spot, communicating with each other, and even achieving cooperation, and also allows more newcomers to learn about the current CARDANO projects which could really generate a very positive impact.
f6_assessments.q1: From the experience of the two event organizers, they have the experience of co-organizing CARDANO SUMMIT 2021 in Buenos Aires, so they are very experienced in large events, we can also see from the video that the event is really well organized, the whole arrangement is very orderly, all the things that should be paid attention to and the details of large events are also very well arranged, I think they can definitely organize a very successful, so the feasibility is really high!!
f6_assessments.q2: It´s perfectly auditable. We can audit and evaluate the success of the events through events videos, photos, number of applicants and number of participants. Just as we evaluate the possible success of their project through their CARDANO SUMMIT photos and videos from last year.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposal’s objective is to organise in-person meet-ups in Buenos Aires over the course of 12 months following the proposal’s funding. The aim of these meetups is to bring already existing Catalyst members together, to get to know each other better, to organise teams or to attract possible new members in the Catalyst/Cardano ecosystem.
The proposal’s objectives are in line with the challenge briefing and it also has a potential positive impact on the ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q1: The timeline for the project is detailed and separated per 3 cycles over the course of one year. The budget is broken down into categories and with detailed descriptions for numbers of hours needed, price per hour and a small amount allocated for materials preparation. The team has provided a detailed description of their prior work, as well as a video of their prior event organised. As such, I find the proposal well written and with the details given it can be successfully implemented.
f6_assessments.q2:
Photos and video are a good measure of progress, though for such large meet-ups there could have been other metrics included, like number of people registering online, mentions on social media channels, etc that could serve not just as proof for the Catalyst community but maybe in time as advertisement for the event itself.
The project’s success is sufficiently well envisioned, there is no need for additional info on this topic.

f6_assessments.q0:
The focus of this proposal is on increasing the membership numbers in Buenos Aires and bringing in investors for the proposals. It’s a very straightforward approach: organize 12 events to grow the community from 650 to 1200 members and bring in 12 investors.

The problem statement fails to impress  but I understand there is a bit of a language barrier and expressing the ideas in Spanish would have been easier. The proposal should verbalize how the team intends to build up the Community Hub and drive adoption and awareness through its activities, empowering people on the ground level. There is a good point that post-Covid it’s nice to meet people face-to-face. Apart from these Meetups online communication is handled in Discord, regular LATAM Cardano Townhall and in Twitter.
f6_assessments.q1:
It is very likely that this proposal will be implemented according to the plan. The proposers have already been organizing the Buenos Aires Summit 2021 and they are active participants in the LATAM community. What could make the proposal stronger is adding some pointers about the content of the meetups, planned speakers and community activities between events.
The strongest point of the proposal is that the cost is very low. One event will cost less than $1,000. This is definitely value for money.

The only risk mentioned is Covid-related. Therefore, it would be good to know what happens to the proposal if yet another variant sweeps over Argentina and all public events are canceled. Also, there is no indication given how the community in Buenos Aires will aim to become financially sustainable. Apart from these shortfalls, as said, the proposers will in all likelihood deliver what they promise.
f6_assessments.q2: The team’s projections for onboarded hub members and involved investors are clearly outlined in 3, 6, and 12 month intervals. Apart from that there are no other metrics mentioned. The budget is simple and detailed. Plan is understandable. Auditing relies on “pictures and videos of the events” and the cumulative number of participants in the community can be tracked on the public meetup page.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal is to conduct a monthly event for 12 months at 11K USD to raise awareness and attract participation for the project. This is likely to spread the adoption of Cardano, hence in alignment with the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposers had organised the Cardano summit in the 2020 Buenos Aires. Therefore they must have the capability to organise events on the proposed scale. The task is relatively simple with the resources and ground presence. It is likely to be completed by the proposers.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposers aim to attract 800, 1000 and  1200 people to the meets. Therefore the expense seems to be ok for 1K USD for a meet. which seems to be a reasonable amount. The event can be monitored for attendance and its success can be measured based on the conduct of the event. Hence the same is highly auditable.

solution: Host presential events once a month providing interactions, business opportunities, workshops in Cardano community and attract newcomers.
experience:
Co-organizer of Cardano Summit 2020 in Buenos Aires

Co-host of Meetup Cardano Blockchain Buenos Aires with 649 members

Cooperation with LATAM Cardano Community

Community Manager of stake pool
